Package gameinterface

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ColorDialogBox
    A modal dialog box that pops to ask the user to input a color using a color wheel.
    ColorFieldPanel
    A property field for Color.
    ControlPanel
    Part of the game window responsible for interacting with the game.
    It hosts the nodal widget and the element managers.
    The elements managers are ElementDetailPanel instances.
    They are derivated from JToolBar which allows the user to freely rearrange their positions.
    ElementDetailPanel
    This class is used to display the details of an element.
    In practice it's used as a part of the ElementManagerToolBar.
    It's mainly composed of property fields panel.

    Don't directly use this class, but instead use the surface or species derivated ones as they have additionnal fields specific to those element subclasses.
    ElementManagerToolBar<T extends Element>
    Create an element manager as a tool bar.

    Includes the list for the different elements,
    buttons to add/remove/rearrange them,
    a viewer to inspect and modify a specific element.
    GameFrame
    The game's window.
    It's basically composed of a MenuBar on top, a ControlPanel on the left side and a WorldPanel on the right side.
    LoadEvent
    A simple ActionEvent that carries a gameManager reference, used to trigger ActionListeners after loading a savefile.
    NewWorldDialogBox
    The dialog box that will pop to start a new world.
    This dialog box proposes 8 options to create a new world.
    Some of those options requires to give terrain dimensions, which can be done using the text fields at the bottom.
    NewWorldTemplate
    This class holds all the information needed by the GameManagerBuilder class to create the wanted GameManager.
    NodalEditor
    The controller class for nodal editors.
    NodalEditorBuilder
    A class with only static methods, meant to build the standard node editors we use in the software.
    PrinterMessage
    Simple class to hold a message to print.
    PrinterToolBar
    ToolBar holding the printer and its related component, including 2 JToggbleButtons and one TextFieldPanel.
    The JToggleButtons
    PropertyFieldPanel
    The property field class is a panel where a property is represented by a JLabel that displays the property name and a component that depends on the property.
    This class should be derived depending on the property type you want.
    For each derived class, remeber to add a field/button to display and interact with your property value, as this class only displays its name.
    SpeciesDetailPanel
    Derived class to display all the properties of a species.
    SurfaceDetailPanel
    Derived class to display all the properties of a surface.
    TerrainManagerToolBar
    ToolBar for viewing and editing the terrain.
    It includes a visualizer of the different models and buttons to re-arrange them, delete one or add one.
    It also displays the dimensions of the terrain as well as the terrain trigger time (that last one can be modified)
    TerrainVisualizerPanel
    Complete visualizer of the terrainSlots of a Terrain.
    It display the visualization of the slots (using a TerrainStackVisualizer) as well as buttons to change the focused slot, and buttons to add/move/remove the slots.
    TextFieldPanel
    A property field for text that can be edited.
    TextFixedFieldPanel
    A property field for a NON editable text.
    WorldPanel
    This class manages how the display of the world.
    The display consists of grid of tile representing the map.
